short_description: Discover Chad, a landlocked Central African nation known for its diverse landscapes from the Sahara Desert in the north to savannas in the south. Explore Lake Chad, experience rich cultural traditions, and immerse yourself in the unique heritage of this Sahelian country.

health.tap_water_safety: Not safe to drink - bottled or filtered water is recommended
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, restaurants, and stores
Alcohol consumption is legal but may be restricted in some regions due to Islamic cultural norms

tipping.hotels: Small tips for porters and housekeeping are appreciated
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service, though not always expected
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Chad has diverse climates ranging from desert in the north to tropical in the south. The country experiences a dry season from November to April and a wet season from May to October, with extreme heat in the north and more moderate temperatures in the south.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Hot and dry weather, making this the best time to visit. Perfect for exploring cities, visiting Lake Chad, and outdoor activities. Ideal conditions for wildlife viewing and sightseeing, though temperatures can be very high

when_to_visit.title: Shoulder Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Transition periods with occasional rain showers. Still manageable for travel, but be prepared for some rainfall. Good time to visit before or after the peak dry season

when_to_visit.title: Wet Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Heavy rainfall and high humidity, especially in the south. Challenging conditions for travel, with flooding possible in some areas. Not ideal for most tourists, though the countryside is lush and green

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Chad is during the dry season from November to April when the weather is hot and dry, making it ideal for exploring cities, visiting Lake Chad, and outdoor activities, though be prepared for very high temperatures
